TopicTitle: Crash to desktop during initial loading.

Articles.Content:
KSP: 1.0.4 Linux x64

Issue: KSP ctd during loading

I can't figure this out for the life of me. I just now updated to 1.0.4 will all up-to date mods but I'm suffering a CTD during loading when MM is installed, I tested it without MM and it loads fine though.

I'm running 64-bit on linux with 8gb of ram and KSP stays well below the limit so it's not a memory-related crash.

I thought at first that it was a ModualManager related problem because the game loads when MM is not installed but someone on that thead said that's not the case.

[Log provided.](https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B0BZCbirvqyweGFRcmFTUUZjYm8/view?usp=sharing)

Does this happen with every launch? Or, just occasionally? Personally speaking, it looks like a random CTD; these happen.

If it is MM related, make sure you are running v2.6.6. I'm running Linux x64, 32GB; run a heavily modded install and it loads fine. I approach the KSP hard 16GB upper limit.

Also, check ~/.config/unity3d/Squad/Kerbal Space Program/Player.log to see what that tells you.

Next, try unzipping and overwrite all the original KSP except the GameData folder. I've had installs that ended-up borked and that helped.

I've 87 add-ons and it takes about 4m to load. Get yourself a SSD. 25m load time is horrendous. It may actually be your processor.

My Setup:

Kerbal Space Program - 1.0.4.0 (LinuxPlayer)

OS: Linux 3.19 Ubuntu 15.04 64bit

CPU: Intel® Core i7-2600K CPU @ 3.40GHz (8)

RAM: 32143

GPU: GeForce GTX 560 Ti/PCIe/SSE2 (1024MB)

SM: 30 (OpenGL 4.5 [4.5.0 NVIDIA 346.59])

RT Formats: ARGB32, Depth, ARGBHalf, RGB565, ARGB4444, ARGB1555, Default, DefaultHDR, ARGBFloat, RGFloat, RGHalf, RFloat, RHalf, R8

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-18T17:12:37Z" title="07/18/2015 05:12  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 18, 2015</time> by TranceaddicT**
  
My setup

That removing MM resolves this only indicates that one of the mods *using* MM is the cause, not MM itself. I don't see an immediate answer in that log, so your best bet might be to remove mods one or two at a time until it loads. Tiresome I know, but that's just what we have to do sometimes with heavily modded installs.

Better yet, if this is a fresh install: Always add mods a couple at a time, that way you can spot issues before they get buried.
